name: 餐旅行銷專案管理研究
description: This course is a three-hour graduate survey course focused on the strategic analysis and planning necessary to effectively match marketing strategies with changing macro, micro, and organizational environments. The course is intended to provide an understanding of the conceptual realm of hospitality marketing strategy and knowledge of the factors for consideration in making strategic marketing decisions in the hospitality industry. Pedagogy is based on business simulation, case analysis and discussion.
goals: To improve and broaden the student's abilities to identify hospitality marketing problems and to develop reasoned resolutions of these problems.

To develop an expanded appreciation and understanding of the relationship among marketing decision variables – product, price, promotion and channels – and how the whole package is put together for effectiveness.
To broaden the student's understanding of the scope and role of marketing as a
To examine the ethical challenges and opportunities in business marketing

1.  **Introduction to the Course** 
2.  **Marketing Challenges in the Hospitality Industry**  
3.  ****Scanning Your Marketing Environment**** 
4.  **Understanding Your Customers -- Market Research**  
5.  **Your Products and Services & USP** 
6.  **Your Pricing Strategies** 
7.  **Importance of First-Time Customers** 
8.  **Your Place Strategies + Your Promotion Strategies (Part 1)**   
9.  **Your Creativity in Promotion (Part 2)**  
10.   **Guest Talk (\* to be confirmed)** 
11.  **Your Branding & Brand Communication (Part 1)** 
12.  **Your Branding & Brand Communication (Part 2)**  
13.  **Your Physical Evidence – Creativity and Alignment**  
14.  **Taking Care of Your People -- Internal Marketing & Interactive Marketing**

methodologies.note: Problem-based learning – case studies / field studies
Collaborative learning – group market research projects

grading.note: A marketing experience sharing (max. 5 minutes oral presentation + PPT)
Attend class and participate in in-class discussions and activities.
Group Mini-Task - Present on an assigned marketing topic (hands-on marketing skills)
Conduct a group market research project on a hospitality organization or a hospitality product/service of your own choice. (max. 5 groups – max. 25 minutes)
